Yeti3D is a portable 3D game engine inspired by the [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cube_FPS CUBE] engine and designed by Derek J. Evans.  It was originally designed for the Gameboy Advance and other handheld devices.  It has been ported to such devices as the Gamepark GP32, Sony PlayStation, Nintendo GameCube, Pocket PC, Nokia Series 60 mobile phones, iPhone, Windows PC (using OpenGL, DirectDraw, [http://www.storm-studios.net/onethirty8/Yetistuff.html and SDL]), [http://www.storm-studios.net/onethirty8/Yetistuff.html Apple MacIntosh (using SDL)], and the [http://www.dreamcast-scene.com/index.php/Main/Yeti3D first port to the Sega Dreamcast] was done in 2004 by a member of the Dreamcast homebrew software community known as Vortexx.
